game.resources

Class Resources

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.resources.Resources

  • public class Resources
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a group of resources and offers methods for modifying them.
    Author:
    Christoph Hermann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Resources()
      Creates new resources.
      Resources(ResourceType type, int amount)
      Creates new resources containing a certain amount of resources of the specified type.
      Resources(ResourceType type1, int amount1, ResourceType type2, int amount2)
      Creates new resources containing a certain amount of resources of the specified types.
      Resources(ResourceType type1, int amount1, ResourceType type2, int amount2, ResourceType type3, int amount3)
      Creates new resources containing a certain amount of resources of the specified types.
      Resources(ResourceType type1, int amount1, ResourceType type2, int amount2, ResourceType type3, int amount3, ResourceType type4, int amount4)
      Creates new resources containing a certain amount of resources of the specified types.
      Resources(ResourceType type1, int amount1, ResourceType type2, int amount2, ResourceType type3, int amount3, ResourceType type4, int amount4, ResourceType type5, int amount5)
      Creates new resources containing a certain amount of resources of the specified types.

        Creates new resources containing a certain amount of resources of the specified type.

        amount - the amount of resources of the given type.

        type1 - the first ResourceType.
        amount1 - the amount of resources of the first type.
        type2 - the second ResourceType.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Resources additionalResources)
        Adds additional resources to the existing ones.
        Parameters:
        additionalResources - the resources to be added.

      • addResources

        public Resources addResources(Resources addResources)
        Create a new Resources Object and adds the additional ones.
        Parameters:
        addResources - the resources to be added.
        Returns:
        re the new resources

      • subtract

        public void subtract(Resources additionalResources)
        Subtracts additional resources from the existing ones. If the existing resources doesn't already contain a ResourceType contained by the additional resources, it will be added (with a negative value).
        Parameters:
        additionalResources - the resources to be subtracted.

      • subtractResources

        public Resources subtractResources(Resources additionalResources)
        Create a new resource object and subtract additional resources from the existing ones. If the existing resources doesn't already contain a ResourceType contained by the additional resources, it will be added (with a negative value).
        Parameters:
        additionalResources - the resources to be subtracted.
        Returns:
        re new resources list

      • addOneTypeResource

        public void addOneTypeResource(int resource,
                               ResourceType resourceType)
        Add resource of one ResourceType to existing resources
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to be added
        resourceType - the Type of resource which to be added

      • subtractOneTypeResource

        public void subtractOneTypeResource(int resource,
                                    ResourceType resourceType)
        Subtract resource of one ResourceType from existing resources
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to be subtracted
        resourceType - the Type of resource which to be subtracted

      • multiply

        public void multiply(int multiplier)
        Multiplies the amount of resources by a given value.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - the value that the resources are multiplied by.

      • set

        public void set(Resources newResources)
        Sets the amount of resources of each type of this resources object to the amount specified by another resources object.
        Parameters:
        newResources - the other resources object.

      • getResourceTypeFromTrad

        public ResourceType getResourceTypeFromTrad()
        Get ResourceType of supply and demand when server receives sea trade require This method is used in serverController for seaTrad
        Returns:
        type ResourceType

      • isGreaterThanOrEqualTo

        public boolean isGreaterThanOrEqualTo(Resources comparedResources)
        Compares these resources to other resources and calculates if these resources are greater than or equal to the other ones.
        Parameters:
        comparedResources - the resources to compare against.
        Returns:
        true, if these resources are greater than or equal to the compared resources. false, otherwise.

      • getResources

        public javafx.beans.property.SimpleMapProperty<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> getResources()
        Returns a Map representing the resources and their amount.
        Returns:
        the resources and their amount.

      • getSum

        public int getSum()
        Calculates the sum of these resources.
        Returns:
        the sum of resources.

      • convertResources

        public int[] convertResources()
        Converts these resources into an integer Array.
        Returns:
        the integer Array containing the amounts of resources of each type.

      • convertIntToResources

        public static Resources convertIntToResources(int[] resources)
        Converts an array with length 5 into an Resource Object
        Parameters:
        resources - list of resources
        Returns:
        re list of resources

      • convertIntToResourceType

        public static ResourceType convertIntToResourceType(int intResource)
        converts an int to a resourceType 0 = "Lumber", 1 = "Wool", 2 = "Grain", 3 = "Brick", 4 = "Ore".
        Parameters:
        intResource - type of resource as integer
        Returns:
        ResourceType
